userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Try and lower the amount of red meat intake, stay away from shellfish as much as possible. Fish, chicken and turkey are great options. When eating fish try to stick to lighter color fishes(tuna is high agitators for gout) stay away from alcohol(you can drink but not too much or to often). Stay away from too much salt and also beans. You will be fine. Work out, that helps. Don't forget to drink a lot of water to flush and balance your body.

condition.description:
Gout is a common, painful form of arthritis. It causes swollen, red, hot and stiff joints.

Gout happens when uric acid builds up in your body. Uric acid comes from the breakdown of substances called purines. Purines are in your body's tissues and in foods, such as liver, dried beans and peas, and anchovies. Normally, uric acid dissolves in the blood. It passes through the kidneys and out of the body in urine. But sometimes uric acid can build up and form needle-like crystals. When they form in your joints, it is very painful. The crystals can also cause kidney stones.

Often, gout first attacks your big toe. It can also attack ankles, heels, knees, wrists, fingers, and elbows. At first, gout attacks usually get better in days. Eventually, attacks last longer and happen more often.

You are more likely to get gout if you

  • Are a man
  • Have family member with gout
  • Are overweight
  • Drink alcohol
  • Eat too many foods rich in purines

Gout can be hard to diagnose. Your doctor may take a sample of fluid from an inflamed joint to look for crystals. You can treat gout with medicines.

Pseudogout has similar symptoms and is sometimes confused with gout. However, it is caused by calcium phosphate, not uric acid.

NIH: National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases
condition.name: Gout
symptoms: Usually affects your big toe first, but can also affect ankles, heels, knees, wrists, fingers, and elbows

carousel_items: Drink plenty of water while taking this medication.
Take with food or milk to prevent an upset stomach.
It takes at least 2 to 6 weeks to experience the full benefit of this medication.
Your doctor can run blood tests to make sure the medication is working as it should.

clock.tip: Take after meals and drink plenty of water.

basics.benefits_moa: Allopurinol is a type of medicine called a xanthine oxidase inhibitor. It lowers uric acid levels in your blood, which prevents gout attacks and certain types of kidney stones.
basics.bottom_line: Allopurinol works well to prevent gout attacks and is cheaper than some alternatives, but it takes a few weeks to kick in.
downsides: Can actually increase the number of gout attacks in the first few weeks.
It can take 2 to 6 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
You should drink a lot of fluids to prevent kidney stones from forming while taking this medication.

downsides_processed.orig: Can actually increase the number of gout attacks in the first few weeks.
It can take 2 to 6 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
You should drink a lot of fluids to prevent kidney stones from forming while taking this medication.

upsides: Works well to lower the amount of uric acid in the body to reduce gout attacks.
Available as a generic medication.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to lower the amount of uric acid in the body to reduce gout attacks.
Available as a generic medication.

userStories.tip: I was taking Allopurinol from 2000. I underwent for an operation in the big toe and subsequently in Elbow joint due to Gout problem.

userStories.identifier: 51 years old slightly obese not fit
userStories.tip: I used to use it long term for gout prevention but essentially after a year i weaned off. Now if i get an inkling of an attack, I take about 1000mg and it works to stop the attack. I know that's not the indicated way, but
I couldn't exist without it.

I'm on just about the lowest dose available (100mg 2x daily) and my uric acid is very well controlled, plus I don't have to been too fussy with my diet (e.g., I can consume mushrooms, spinach, etc., and other relatively high purine foods).

drugs.name: Allopurinol

off-label_indications.indication: High uric acid from taking a thiazide

carousel_items_processed.orig: Drink plenty of water while taking this medication.
Take with food or milk to prevent an upset stomach.
It takes at least 2 to 6 weeks to experience the full benefit of this medication.
Your doctor can run blood tests to make sure the medication is working as it should.

risks_warnings.title: Increased gout attacks
risks_warnings.description: People who first start Allopurinol can experience increased gout attacks as they take the medication for the first few weeks. This is common. Your doctor can prescribe other medications to prevent these attacks from occurring.

description_processed.orig: People who first start Allopurinol can experience increased gout attacks as they take the medication for the first few weeks. This is common. Your doctor can prescribe other medications to prevent these attacks from occurring.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: People who take Allopurinol can be more likely to have kidney stones, especially if you're dehydrated. Drink at least 10 to 12 eight ounce glasses of water every day to help prevent that from happening.

description_processed.orig: People who take Allopurinol can be more likely to have kidney stones, especially if you're dehydrated. Drink at least 10 to 12 eight ounce glasses of water every day to help prevent that from happening.

risks_warnings.title: Skin rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people taking Allopurinol who get a severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people taking Allopurinol who get a severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

risks_warnings.title: Liver disease
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Allopurinol who have suffered liver damage sometimes to the point of liver transplant. This has been rare. If you notice yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, or abdominal pain, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Allopurinol who have suffered liver damage sometimes to the point of liver transplant. This has been rare. If you notice yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, or abdominal pain, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: Take it with or without food.
At the first sign of a gout attack, take two tablets. Don't take more than three tablets a day in order to avoid serious side effects.
Wait at least 3 days before another using Colchicine again.
Almost all people experience some nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea after taking Colchicine.
Let your doctor know of any serious nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or if you have tingling in your fingers or toes.

basics.benefits_moa: Colchicine is a second choice antigout medication that prevents acute gout attacks by reducing inflammation.
basics.bottom_line: Colchicine is a second-choice treatment for gout attacks. Be careful how much you use since it causes a lot of side effects.
downsides: Doesn't work as well as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or corticosteroids to treat gout attacks.
Taking too much can cause serious side effects.
Doses needs to be adjusted if you have kidney or liver problems.
Doesn't have the ability to ease or treat pain.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't work as well as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or corticosteroids to treat gout attacks.
Taking too much can cause serious side effects.
Doses needs to be adjusted if you have kidney or liver problems.
Doesn't have the ability to ease or treat pain.

upsides: Is an antigout medication that has anti-inflammatory properties to help treat sudden gout attacks.
Lowers the risk of sudden gout attacks when taken as prescribed to prevent gout attacks.
Also treats Familial Mediterranean Fever.

upsides_processed.orig: Is an antigout medication that has anti-inflammatory properties to help treat sudden gout attacks.
Lowers the risk of sudden gout attacks when taken as prescribed to prevent gout attacks.
Also treats Familial Mediterranean Fever.

userStories.tip: Take 2 pills of 6 mg as soon as you feel that pain is coming followed by one 6 mg every 8 hours. Mild diarrhea is to be expected but colchicine does prevent gout attacks.  Also go for a walk/run or climb steps as you feel pain is coming

drugs.name: Colcrys

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it with or without food.
At the first sign of a gout attack, take two tablets. Don't take more than three tablets a day in order to avoid serious side effects.
Wait at least 3 days before another using Colchicine again.
Almost all people experience some nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea after taking Colchicine.
Let your doctor know of any serious nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or if you have tingling in your fingers or toes.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Colchicine can lower your body's ability to make new blood cells. This can happen even when you're using the appropriate doses. Let your doctor know if you have frequent bleeding/bruising, fevers, or always feel tired.

description_processed.orig: Colchicine can lower your body's ability to make new blood cells. This can happen even when you're using the appropriate doses. Let your doctor know if you have frequent bleeding/bruising, fevers, or always feel tired.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Colchicine have reported muscle pain which can lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness, or a fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Colchicine have reported muscle pain which can lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness, or a fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Death from overdose
risks_warnings.description: Fatal overdoses, both accidental and intentional, have been reported in adults and children who have ingested too much colchicine. Colchicine capsules should be kept out of the reach of children.

description_processed.orig: Fatal overdoses, both accidental and intentional, have been reported in adults and children who have ingested too much colchicine. Colchicine capsules should be kept out of the reach of children.

carousel_items: Starts relieving pain in 30 to 60 minutes.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Naproxen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Naproxen works well for mild to moderate pain and inflammation, and it lasts longer than other NSAIDs.
downsides: It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain, swelling, and fevers.
Good for menstrual cramps, toothaches, body aches, and mild arthritis pain.
Lasts longer than Ibuprofen, so you can take it less often.
Naproxen works as well as Aspirin and Indomethacin to treat arthritis pain, and causes fewer stomach problems.
Although not without side effects, it's been around for a long time and is generally safe for short-term use.

Although not without side effects, it's been around for a long time and is generally safe for short-term use.

userStories.tip: Its best pain killer just concerned about long term usage ..
Took 3 for a bad headache.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: Was prescribed naproxen for shoulder pain and inflammation, twice a day for 10 days. Pain disappeared almost immediately. No discernible side effects. Hoping the effects will be long lasting after stopping the medication.
It takes about a day to kick in.
definitely take with food.
I take it occasionally for back pain.

Naproxen was great the first time I used it for a few weeks. But I unknowingly developed an allergy to it, so the next time I took it 6 months later, I broke out in hives and my face swelled up like a balloon. So I can't take it anymore.
userStories.identifier: physically active person with knee pain
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: Found it best to take with food.

drugs.name: Naproxen

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts relieving pain in 30 to 60 minutes.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this problem. Don't take Naproxen after having heart surgery for at least two weeks.

description_processed.orig: Naproxen can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this problem. Don't take Naproxen after having heart surgery for at least two weeks.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Naproxen, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Naproxen can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Naproxen, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Naproxen. Don't take Naproxen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Naproxen.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Naproxen. Don't take Naproxen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Naproxen.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Naproxen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Naproxen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Lower kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Naproxen for any amount of time.

description_processed.orig: Naproxen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Naproxen for any amount of time.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Naproxen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

carousel_items: In the first few months of taking Uloric, you can still have gout attacks. Dont give up since it takes a while to fully work. Your doctor can give you another medication to help until it's working well.
Take Uloric at the same time everyday, with or without food.
To make sure Uloric is working, have your blood checked often.
To help prevent attacks, avoid beer, sugary drinks, and foods like red meat, seafood, turkey, asparagus, cauliflower, spinach, and mushrooms.

basics.benefits_moa: Uloric is an antigout xanthine oxidase inhibitor. It decreases the build up of uric acid, the enzyme that causes gout.
basics.bottom_line: Uloric is a once a day medication for chronic gout, but it takes a few weeks to kick in.
downsides: Can increase the amount of gout attacks in the first few weeks.
You need to drink a lot of fluids while taking this to prevent kidney stones from forming.
While taking Uloric, you'll have to get your blood checked often.
Doesn't come in a generic version.

downsides_processed.orig: Can increase the amount of gout attacks in the first few weeks.
You need to drink a lot of fluids while taking this to prevent kidney stones from forming.
While taking Uloric, you'll have to get your blood checked often.
Doesn't come in a generic version.

upsides: In one clinical trial, Uloric was shown to decrease uric acid to normal levels in over half of the people taking it. It worked better than Zyloprim (allopurinol).
You only need to take Uloric once a day.
Uloric can be used in people with mild to moderate kidney disease.

upsides_processed.orig: In one clinical trial, Uloric was shown to decrease uric acid to normal levels in over half of the people taking it. It worked better than Zyloprim (allopurinol).
You only need to take Uloric once a day.
Uloric can be used in people with mild to moderate kidney disease.

drugs.name: Uloric

carousel_items_processed.orig: In the first few months of taking Uloric, you can still have gout attacks. Dont give up since it takes a while to fully work. Your doctor can give you another medication to help until it's working well.
Take Uloric at the same time everyday, with or without food.
To make sure Uloric is working, have your blood checked often.
To help prevent attacks, avoid beer, sugary drinks, and foods like red meat, seafood, turkey, asparagus, cauliflower, spinach, and mushrooms.

risks_warnings.title: Gout flare-ups
risks_warnings.description: An increase in gout flares is commonly seen when first starting Uloric. This is due to the movement of uric acid that is built up in your body. While your body gets used to Uloric, an additional medication can help prevent these flare-ups.

description_processed.orig: An increase in gout flares is commonly seen when first starting Uloric. This is due to the movement of uric acid that is built up in your body. While your body gets used to Uloric, an additional medication can help prevent these flare-ups.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: In a clinical study, there was a higher rate of blood clotting incidents, non-deadly strokes, and heart attacks in people taking Uloric, than in people taking allopurinol. For this reason it is important to watch out for signs of heart attack and stroke.

description_processed.orig: In a clinical study, there was a higher rate of blood clotting incidents, non-deadly strokes, and heart attacks in people taking Uloric, than in people taking allopurinol. For this reason it is important to watch out for signs of heart attack and stroke.

risks_warnings.title: Liver problems
risks_warnings.description: Because people taking this medication have suffered fatal and non-fatal liver failure, it is important to have liver function blood work done before starting Uloric. In addition, it is important to have these tests done anytime your doctor feels you may have liver injury. This can be the case if you become overly tired, begin to loose an unusual amount of weight, have severe pain on the right side of your abdomen, have dark urine, or a yellow appearance of your skin. Be sure to talk to a doctor if this occurs.

description_processed.orig: Because people taking this medication have suffered fatal and non-fatal liver failure, it is important to have liver function blood work done before starting Uloric. In addition, it is important to have these tests done anytime your doctor feels you may have liver injury. This can be the case if you become overly tired, begin to loose an unusual amount of weight, have severe pain on the right side of your abdomen, have dark urine, or a yellow appearance of your skin. Be sure to talk to a doctor if this occurs.

carousel_items: Take Cambia at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to reduce your risk of heart attack.
Can cause swelling in the legs, an upset stomach, constipation, and abdominal pain.
Don't drink alcohol or smoke while on Cambia since that can increase the risk of stomach issues.

basics.benefits_moa: Cambia is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Cambia is an okay medication used to treat pain and swelling. However, because of the risk of heart attack, it's recommended to limit the amount you take.
downsides: Has to be taken for the shortest amount of time possible to lower the risk of heart attack.
If you're taking it on a regular basis, you'll need to get labs done to make sure your liver and kidneys aren't being affected.
You should avoid smoking and using alcohol while on Cambia since they can increase your risk of stomach problems.
You can't take Cambia if you have phenylketonuria (PKU) since the packets contain aspartame (phenylalanine).

downsides_processed.orig: Has to be taken for the shortest amount of time possible to lower the risk of heart attack.
If you're taking it on a regular basis, you'll need to get labs done to make sure your liver and kidneys aren't being affected.
You should avoid smoking and using alcohol while on Cambia since they can increase your risk of stomach problems.
You can't take Cambia if you have phenylketonuria (PKU) since the packets contain aspartame (phenylalanine).

upsides: Can be used as needed to treat pain and swelling.
Recommended for treating arthritis pain and swelling if acetaminophen (Tylenol) isn't working.
Available as a generic, so it is cheap.

upsides_processed.orig: Can be used as needed to treat pain and swelling.
Recommended for treating arthritis pain and swelling if acetaminophen (Tylenol) isn't working.
Available as a generic, so it is cheap.

drugs.one_liner: Treats mild to moderate pain and swelling.

userStories.identifier: A chronic babe who loves animals

userStories.tip: I only take it when my head hurts really bad and it almost always works.

drugs.name: Cambia

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Cambia at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to reduce your risk of heart attack.
Can cause swelling in the legs, an upset stomach, constipation, and abdominal pain.
Don't drink alcohol or smoke while on Cambia since that can increase the risk of stomach issues.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Cambia can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Cambia during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Cambia can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Cambia during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Cambia can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Cambia can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Cambia. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Cambia. Don't take Cambia while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Cambia. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Cambia. Don't take Cambia while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Lowers kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Cambia, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Cambia for long periods of time.
risk_factors: Taking ACE inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs)

description_processed.orig: Cambia, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Cambia for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Cambia can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Cambia can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Cambia can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Cambia can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Reaction to aspartame (phenylalanine)
risks_warnings.description: Cambia packets contain aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU don't take Cambia packets. There are other dosage forms that may be better for you. Ask your doctor or pharmacist.

description_processed.orig: Cambia packets contain aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU don't take Cambia packets. There are other dosage forms that may be better for you. Ask your doctor or pharmacist.

carousel_items: Starts working in 1 to 3 hours.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

basics.benefits_moa: Celebrex is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Celebrex works well for treating pain and causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs.
downsides: It's not available as a generic medication, so it's more expensive than many alternatives.
The longer you take Celebrex, the more likely you are to have stomach problems, including inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. This can also happen if you take Celebrex on an empty stomach.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of blood clots, heart attack, or a stroke.
Can also affect your kidneys or cause permanent kidney damage if taken for a long time.

downsides_processed.orig: It's not available as a generic medication, so it's more expensive than many alternatives.
The longer you take Celebrex, the more likely you are to have stomach problems, including inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. This can also happen if you take Celebrex on an empty stomach.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of blood clots, heart attack, or a stroke.
Can also affect your kidneys or cause permanent kidney damage if taken for a long time.

upsides: Relieves pain and inflammation for many types of arthritis, including osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and juvenile rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for treating muscle aches and pains, as well as menstrual cramps.
Causes fewer stomach problems than other NSAIDs like Ibuprofen or Naproxen.
Lasts longer than Ibuprofen.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves pain and inflammation for many types of arthritis, including osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and juvenile rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for treating muscle aches and pains, as well as menstrual cramps.
Causes fewer stomach problems than other NSAIDs like Ibuprofen or Naproxen.
Lasts longer than Ibuprofen.

userStories.identifier: I have fibromyalgia and found it helps.
Super active with arthritis in back

userStories.tip: Seemed to work for a couple of weeks.  Then started using it twice a day due to more pain and feeling bad. Finally I realized the temporal headaches, neck stiffness, leg edema and pain were from Celebrex! Took over a week to go away!!!!
I've had good luck with taking it in the AM
if I stop for a few days, I experience pain again and then it takes several days of taking the medication before I am pain free again. It does not provide instant relief

drugs.name: Celebrex

off-label_indications.indication: Colorectal polyp prevention for people with high risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in 1 to 3 hours.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack and stroke
risks_warnings.description: Taking Celebrex for extended amounts of time can raise your risk of heart attack or stroke, especially if you've had a history of heart disease or are planning heart bypass surgery. Take Celebrex for the shortest amount of time possible needed to control your symptoms to lower this risk. Talk to your doctor about alternatives to Celebrex if you're going to have heart bypass surgery.
risk_factors: History of heart bypass surgery (coronary artery bypass graft/CABG)

description_processed.orig: Taking Celebrex for extended amounts of time can raise your risk of heart attack or stroke, especially if you've had a history of heart disease or are planning heart bypass surgery. Take Celebrex for the shortest amount of time possible needed to control your symptoms to lower this risk. Talk to your doctor about alternatives to Celebrex if you're going to have heart bypass surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Taking Celebrex can raise your risk of ulcers and bleeding in the stomach and intestines, sometimes without warning. Talk to your doctor if you suddenly get sharp pains in your stomach, or you notice bright red blood in your stool or if you notice dark tarry stool.
risk_factors: History of GI bleed or peptic ulcer disease

description_processed.orig: Taking Celebrex can raise your risk of ulcers and bleeding in the stomach and intestines, sometimes without warning. Talk to your doctor if you suddenly get sharp pains in your stomach, or you notice bright red blood in your stool or if you notice dark tarry stool.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Celebrex can raise your blood pressure, especially if you've had high blood pressure or you're taking water pills to treat your blood pressure. Check your blood pressure regularly as instructed by your doctor if this becomes a concern.

description_processed.orig: Celebrex can raise your blood pressure, especially if you've had high blood pressure or you're taking water pills to treat your blood pressure. Check your blood pressure regularly as instructed by your doctor if this becomes a concern.

risks_warnings.title: Increased swelling (edema) and fluid retention
risks_warnings.description: Celebrex can cause your arms and legs to swell, or can cause you to retain water, especially if you've been diagnosed with heart failure.

description_processed.orig: Celebrex can cause your arms and legs to swell, or can cause you to retain water, especially if you've been diagnosed with heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Celebrex have had serious skin reactions, possibly leading to death. However, this has been very rare. Call your doctor or seek emergency help immediately if you develop a sudden high fever with a rash.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Celebrex have had serious skin reactions, possibly leading to death. However, this has been very rare. Call your doctor or seek emergency help immediately if you develop a sudden high fever with a rash.

risks_warnings.title: Asthma attacks
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Celebrex have had serious asthma attacks. However, this has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you've had a history of asthma.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Celebrex have had serious asthma attacks. However, this has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you've had a history of asthma.

risks_warnings.title: Lowered kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Celebrex, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can cause lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage.  You're at higher risk for this if you've a history of kidney disease, heart failure, and liver disease.  Taking Diuretic, ACE inhibitor, or Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (ARB) medications also increases your risk. If you are 65 or older you're also at a higher risk for these types of kidney problems.

description_processed.orig: Celebrex, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can cause lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage.  You're at higher risk for this if you've a history of kidney disease, heart failure, and liver disease.  Taking Diuretic, ACE inhibitor, or Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (ARB) medications also increases your risk. If you are 65 or older you're also at a higher risk for these types of kidney problems.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you are in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks) taking Celebrex can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby.  Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you are in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks) taking Celebrex can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby.  Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Losartan is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). It blocks a chemical that tightens blood vessels. This makes blood vessels relax, which lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Losartan is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function like an ACE inhibitor, but with fewer side effects.
downsides: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Similar to ACE inhibitors (like Lisinopril), with fewer side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Similar to ACE inhibitors (like Lisinopril), with fewer side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

userStories.tip: Don't skip the dose. Take right  away after you remember.
I don't want to take a higher dose but it seems to be losing its effect, but higher blood pressure is now o.k. according to the cardiologists in older people.

userStories.identifier: in excellent condition for my age I
userStories.tip: did develop a dry cough now and then  I didn't realize was losartin side effect. I took it as a much cheaper drug than one I was using which was similar. A 100 dollar difference a month. I tried the more expensive one and then switched back

If I had looked up the adverse side effects before taking it I would never have allowed myself to be put on it! I developed all of them. I felt like I was dying! Now I check out all medication before starting a new prescription!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Varied the times taking it to see if it changed my side effects:swelling below the knee. Stopped after two week when my shoes no longer fit.
Take the medication in the morning at the same time each day.
my physician halved the dose to deal with throat irritation/dry cough
userStories.identifier: fit, active executive with mild HBP

off-label_indications.indication: Lower heart attack and stroke risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Losartan can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Losartan can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Taking Losartan can put you at risk for increased risk of developing or worsening liver function. Let your prescriber know if you have liver disease, including cirrhosis of the liver.

description_processed.orig: Taking Losartan can put you at risk for increased risk of developing or worsening liver function. Let your prescriber know if you have liver disease, including cirrhosis of the liver.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Losartan can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Losartan.

description_processed.orig: Losartan can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Losartan.

carousel_items: If taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth, take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can cause stomach ulcers, especially if taking it by mouth often.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily. You shouldn't take any other 'blood thinner' medications unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Don't use it the first two weeks after a heart surgery.
Can affect your kidneys' ability to work as well.

If using the skin (topical) gel, use the dosing card it comes with to make sure you measure the correct dose. You also won't have many of the same side effects that you would if taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

basics.benefits_moa: Diclofenac sodium is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Diclofenac sodium works well for pain and causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs.
downsides: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
May treat arthritis pain better than other similar medicines (NSAIDs).
Can cause less upset stomach than other NSAIDs like ibuprofen (Advil).
It's also available as a gel that you put on your skin. If it's hard for you to swallow pills, this could be a good option.
If you're only using the gel, you won't have the same side effects that you would while taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
May treat arthritis pain better than other similar medicines (NSAIDs).
Can cause less upset stomach than other NSAIDs like ibuprofen (Advil).
It's also available as a gel that you put on your skin. If it's hard for you to swallow pills, this could be a good option.
If you're only using the gel, you won't have the same side effects that you would while taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

userStories.tip: Took Diclofenac SOD for CPPD (Inflammatory arthritis) for yrs before bilateral knee replacements. 3yrs later, I'm having swelling/pain after golf/long walks/workouts.  Meloxicam didn't help so asked for Diclofenac.  It still works for me!

userStories.identifier: Male with occasionally severe back pain
userStories.tip: My doctor prescribed Voltaren because he has completely undue fears of VicoProfen, but while VicoProfen works exceptionally well, Voltaren has no detectable effect on my pain.
If you feel dizzy, bring it up to your doctor.  Mine lowered the dosage and it helped a lot!

carousel_items_processed.orig: If taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth, take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can cause stomach ulcers, especially if taking it by mouth often.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily. You shouldn't take any other 'blood thinner' medications unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Don't use it the first two weeks after a heart surgery.
Can affect your kidneys' ability to work as well.

If using the skin (topical) gel, use the dosing card it comes with to make sure you measure the correct dose. You also won't have many of the same side effects that you would if taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. Don't take Diclofenac sodium while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. Don't take Diclofenac sodium while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Diclofenac sodium can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Diclofenac sodium and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Diclofenac sodium can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Diclofenac sodium and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Lowers kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Diclofenac sodium for long periods of time.
risk_factors: Taking ACE inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs)

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Diclofenac sodium for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Diclofenac sodium can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Diclofenac sodium can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

carousel_items: Take it with or without food.
At the first sign of a gout attack, take two tablets. Don't take more than three tablets a day in order to avoid serious side effects.
Wait at least 3 days before another using Colchicine again.
Almost all people experience some nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea after taking Colchicine.
Let your doctor know of any serious nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or if you have tingling in your fingers or toes.

basics.benefits_moa: Colchicine is a second choice antigout medication that prevents acute gout attacks by reducing inflammation.
basics.bottom_line: Colchicine is a second-choice treatment for gout attacks. Be careful how much you use since it causes a lot of side effects.
downsides: Doesn't work as well as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or corticosteroids to treat gout attacks.
Taking too much can cause serious side effects.
Doses needs to be adjusted if you have kidney or liver problems.
Doesn't have the ability to ease or treat pain.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't work as well as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or corticosteroids to treat gout attacks.
Taking too much can cause serious side effects.
Doses needs to be adjusted if you have kidney or liver problems.
Doesn't have the ability to ease or treat pain.

upsides: Is an antigout medication that has anti-inflammatory properties to help treat sudden gout attacks.
Lowers the risk of sudden gout attacks when taken as prescribed to prevent gout attacks.
Also treats Familial Mediterranean Fever.

upsides_processed.orig: Is an antigout medication that has anti-inflammatory properties to help treat sudden gout attacks.
Lowers the risk of sudden gout attacks when taken as prescribed to prevent gout attacks.
Also treats Familial Mediterranean Fever.

userStories.tip: Take 2 pills of 6 mg as soon as you feel that pain is coming followed by one 6 mg every 8 hours. Mild diarrhea is to be expected but colchicine does prevent gout attacks.  Also go for a walk/run or climb steps as you feel pain is coming

drugs.name: Colcrys

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it with or without food.
At the first sign of a gout attack, take two tablets. Don't take more than three tablets a day in order to avoid serious side effects.
Wait at least 3 days before another using Colchicine again.
Almost all people experience some nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea after taking Colchicine.
Let your doctor know of any serious nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or if you have tingling in your fingers or toes.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Colchicine can lower your body's ability to make new blood cells. This can happen even when you're using the appropriate doses. Let your doctor know if you have frequent bleeding/bruising, fevers, or always feel tired.

description_processed.orig: Colchicine can lower your body's ability to make new blood cells. This can happen even when you're using the appropriate doses. Let your doctor know if you have frequent bleeding/bruising, fevers, or always feel tired.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Colchicine have reported muscle pain which can lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness, or a fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Colchicine have reported muscle pain which can lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness, or a fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Death from overdose
risks_warnings.description: Fatal overdoses, both accidental and intentional, have been reported in adults and children who have ingested too much colchicine. Colchicine capsules should be kept out of the reach of children.

description_processed.orig: Fatal overdoses, both accidental and intentional, have been reported in adults and children who have ingested too much colchicine. Colchicine capsules should be kept out of the reach of children.

carousel_items: Takes about 30 minutes to start working and can last about 4 to 6 hours.
Can cause stomach ulcers or bleeding. Don't take it with other blood-thinning medicines without talking to your doctor first.
Can cause headaches. If the headaches continue even after you take a lower dose, talk to your doctor about stopping Indomethacin.
The long-acting capsules must be swallowed whole. Don't crush them.
Take with food or milk to help prevent upset stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Indomethacin is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Indomethacin works well for mild to moderate pain and swelling, but it shouldn't be used long-term since it has some serious side effects.
downsides: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

upsides: Effective option to relieve mild to moderate pain and swelling.
Treats inflammation problems, such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and acute gout attacks.
In studies, Indomethacin was more effective than Tylenol for treating osteoarthritis pain.
It works as well as Celebrex for treating an acute gout attacks.
Available in capsules, long-acting capsules, suppositories, and as a suspension. All forms, except the suspension, are available as generic medications.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective option to relieve mild to moderate pain and swelling.
Treats inflammation problems, such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and acute gout attacks.
In studies, Indomethacin was more effective than Tylenol for treating osteoarthritis pain.
It works as well as Celebrex for treating an acute gout attacks.
Available in capsules, long-acting capsules, suppositories, and as a suspension. All forms, except the suspension, are available as generic medications.

userStories.tip: They aren't judging when they say it can make you suck to your stomach. Spent the night on the bathroom floor a couple hours after taking it.
always take with food

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes about 30 minutes to start working and can last about 4 to 6 hours.
Can cause stomach ulcers or bleeding. Don't take it with other blood-thinning medicines without talking to your doctor first.
Can cause headaches. If the headaches continue even after you take a lower dose, talk to your doctor about stopping Indomethacin.
The long-acting capsules must be swallowed whole. Don't crush them.
Take with food or milk to help prevent upset stomach.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life-threatening and can cause death. The risk can increase the longer you take it, but it can happen at any time. Watch out for blood or dark-colored stools. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life-threatening and can cause death. The risk can increase the longer you take it, but it can happen at any time. Watch out for blood or dark-colored stools. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney or liver function
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding or bruising
risks_warnings.description: You can bleed or bruise more easily while taking Indomethacin. Tell your doctor about any medicines you are taking or any health conditions before starting Indomethacin. If you take blood-thinning medicines, don't take Indomethacin without talking to your doctor first.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Try and lower the amount of red meat intake, stay away from shellfish as much as possible. Fish, chicken and turkey are great options. When eating fish try to stick to lighter color fishes(tuna is high agitators for gout) stay away from alcohol(you can drink but not too much or to often). Stay away from too much salt and also beans. You will be fine. Work out, that helps. Don't forget to drink a lot of water to flush and balance your body.
